name: Detail of Activity - Seal designs for Chipseal Membrane
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 seal design per seal application type for the project
Inspection / Test method - Review and acceptance by Client Rep
Acceptance Criteria - Membrane requirements as per project specifications and NZTA specifications
Record documents - Seal Design Report/ Statement justifying stone size and residual binder rate
Comments - As per drawings and specifications usually but if not specified Colas to justify design chip size and application rate, as per NZTA M10 minimum 1 l/m2 residual but used G5 not G4
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 per source stockpile
Acceptance Criteria - NZTA M06 / RNZ 9805:2009 as per G5
Record documents - Certificate in contractor's site folder
Comments - Test certificates issued to the Designer at least 10 days prior to sealing
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 per source stockpile
Acceptance Criteria - NZTA M06 / RNZ 9805:2009 as per G5
Record documents - Certificate in contractor's site folder
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Prior to use
Acceptance Criteria - NZTA M06 / NZTA M13
Record documents - Certificate in contractor's site folder
Comments - Only required if adhesion agent used.
Detail of Activity - Audit samples taken from truck on site
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 20 kg for each sealing day for each chip size used
Acceptance Criteria - Stored in a sealed plastic bag in a covered environment
Record documents - Labelled bags date/time sampled and location and chip type
Comments - Retain for testing if required
Detail of Activity - Weather suitable for sealing
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - The day before sealing and 2 hours prior to sealing
Inspection / Test method - Contractor visual on site and weather forecasts
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm weather conditions are free of rain during sealing and for next 24 hours and surface to be sealed is visually dry and free of surface water'
Record documents - Contractor's site diary and email or verbal confirmation weather ok for sealing
Detail of Activity - Sweep and clean finished basecourse surface prior to sealing
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 100% of area swept and cleaned
Inspection / Test method - Observation area was swept
Acceptance Criteria - Surface is broomed and clean of all dirt, dust, aggregate fines, surface should present a tight mosaic pattern of large aggregate tightly bonded
Record documents - Site diary and photos
Detail of Activity - Visual inspection of surface to be sealed
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - per sealing schedule.
Acceptance Criteria - NZTA B02 - a tight mosaic pattern of large aggregate tightly bonded
Record documents - Contractor's site diary, Photos of site every 20meters

Comments - The surface finish, line and level is checked by Contractor/Designer and approved by Client Rep immediately prior to sealing, for surface levels important there is room for asphalt surface taking into account a 5mm thick chipseal and top of kerb
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - every 20m
Acceptance Criteria - < 5mm using 5m straight edge and no areas that can pond water
Comments - Agree with Contractor and Client Rep on expected finished asphalt surface smoothness based on surface smoothness prior to sealing on granular base
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - every 20m
Comments - Agree with Contractor and Client Rep on expected finished asphalt surface smoothness based on surface smoothness prior to sealing on granular base
Detail of Activity - Dry back Moisture Content
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 9 per Lot
Acceptance Criteria - DOS ≤ 80% preferably ≤ 70% as per NTZA B:02 spec using NDM
Comments - Check moisture content of granular base - Will be completed by Main Contractor whom will have Enginners approval sealing can proceed
Detail of Activity - E/2 Certificate Bitumen Sprayer
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Once per project
Acceptance Criteria - Current compliant E/2 certificate from CCNZ less than 12 months old
Detail of Activity - Bitumen / Bitumen Emulsion for Chip Sealing
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Tested per batch at manufacturing location prior to delivery (test cert for tanker load of bitumen)
Inspection / Test method - Penetration grade testing
Acceptance Criteria - NZTA M01 - Tables 1, 2, 3 and 5
Record documents - Certificate in contractor's site folder
Comments - Bitumen supplier to supply batch number and test certificate for compliance, for this project note batch number used.
Detail of Activity - Bitumen / Bitumen Emulsion for Chip Sealing
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Tested per batch at manufacturing location prior to delivery (test cert for tanker load of bitumen)
Record documents - Certificate in contractor's site folder
Comments - Bitumen supplier to supply batch number and test certificate for compliance, for this project note batch number used.
Detail of Activity - Spraying Temperature (Bitumen only)
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Ongoing with non-going heat sensing gauge
Inspection / Test method - Non-contact heat sensing gun
Comments - Infrared guage record in notebook on site
Detail of Activity - Residual Bitumen Application Rate
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Reconcile day's production
Inspection / Test method - Dockets vs Area
Comments - Need record for each run and include design target
Detail of Activity - Chip Application Rate
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each Days Sealing visual 100% of Area

Acceptance Criteria - For single coat seals the spread rate of the chips shall be such that when fully rolled it will be one stone thick, closely packed shoulder to shoulder, with the individual stones lying flat
Comments - Visually ok no excess chip, better to be slightly less than too much
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Activity over 100% of area
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm minimum two passes of pneumatic roller of chipseal completed and chips lying flat firmly in place
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Activity over 100% of area
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm area swept and cleaned of no loose chip and remove chip outside areas
7.4 - Approval of the days sealing and amendments to sealing method/design if required
Detail of Activity - Client Rep approves the days sealing and agrees a revised dealing design/methodology or Holds /Stops sealing until any concerns, issues and non-comformances are corrected
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each days sealing
Inspection / Test method - Review of the days results and sealing activity plus visual inspection
Acceptance Criteria - Acceptance by Designer and Client Rep

Comments - This item is to sign and agree the days sealing is acceptable and if necessary stop sealing until issues and non-conformances are resolved with the Client Rep before proceeding to the next days sealing.
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.

8.1.1 - Asphalt mix - Lab Made Mix Design
Detail of Activity - Mix design report and JMF

Acceptance Criteria - NZTA M/10, VMA, BFI, AirVoids, etc

Acceptance Criteria - None to report for use by Pavement Designer

Comments - Not required for compliance report of interest only
8.1.3 - Asphalt mix - Lab Made Mix Design

8.2 - Asphalt Mix Design - 6 Monthly Validation and Refinement from Production Mix and Lab and Field Airvoids

Detail of Activity - Aggregate Particle Size Distribution & Binder Content

Acceptance Criteria - As per Lab JMF (BFI, Bitumen Content and Gradings) compliant with NZTA M/10
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
8.2.2 - Asphalt Production Mix to Validate and Refine/Adjust Lab JMF

Inspection / Test method - Gyratory Servopac or
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
8.2.3 - Asphalt Production Mix to Validate and Refine/Adjust Lab JMF
Detail of Activity - Extracted Core Field and/or NDM Air Voids
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - One site less than 12 months old
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Comments - Not needed for DG7 and DG10 mixes
8.2.4 - Asphalt Production Mix to Validate and Refine/Adjust Lab JMF
Detail of Activity - VMA, BFI calculated
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - One site less than 12 months old
Acceptance Criteria - VMA and BFI as per NZTA M10 for mix type
Record documents - Calculated correctly from IANZ test results
8.2.5 - Asphalt Production Mix to Validate and Refine/Adjust Lab JMF
Detail of Activity - JMF adjustment from production and field air voids results
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Once per year

Acceptance Criteria - Detailing justification from production and field results (namely lab and field air voids) a proposed new refined JMF varying within allowable limits of lab jmf as per M10. Generally only target binder content is adjusted up and down from lab JMF based on field air voids compliance
Record documents - Mix Design Re-validation report
8.2.6 - Asphalt Production Mix to Validate and Refine/Adjust Lab JMF
Detail of Activity - Agreement of new refined JMF from Production Mix
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Once per year
Acceptance Criteria - New refined JMF submitted to Designer and Client Rep for acceptance
Record documents - Approval or new JMF
Comments - If adjustments to JMF needed this will be submitted to Engineer for apoproval and to support this AT approval will also be submitted
Detail of Activity - Assessment of all test results for conformity and revised JMF based on Production and Field Results
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - For each mix used on the project
Acceptance Criteria - Reporting of any non-conforming results to Designer via NCR
Comments - Results and reports for revalidation of mix design and associated AT approval will be submitted
Client Final Inspection - the signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the Specifications and verifies lot compliance.
Detail of Activity - Weather suitable for paving
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - The day before paving and 2 hours prior to paving
Inspection / Test method - Contractor visual on site and weather forecasts
Acceptance Criteria - Confirm weather conditions are free of rain and not foggy during sealing and for next 24 hours and surface to be paved is visually dry and free of surface water'
Record documents - Contractor's site diary and email or verbal confirmation weather ok for sealing
Detail of Activity - Temperature of underlying base prior to paving asphalt is >=7 degrees
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 4 randomly located measurements in the shade
Inspection / Test method - Infra Red Temperature Gun
Acceptance Criteria - Temperature on3 out of 4 measurements > 7 degrees on underlying base prior to asphalt
Record documents - Contractors site diary (Photo of temperature gun reading)
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - every 20m
Acceptance Criteria - < 5mm using 5m straight edge and no areas that can pond water
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - every 20m
Detail of Activity - Visual inspection of surface to be sealed
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - per paving schedule.
Acceptance Criteria - If surface is sealed or asphalt then surface must be clean and free of any dust and ponding water.
Comments - The surface finish, line and level, condition is checked by clients Rep. immediately prior to paving
Detail of Activity - Acceptance of Asphalt Paver
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Once per project
Inspection / Test method - Specifications and level controls for Paver

Acceptance Criteria - Specifications and level controls for levels on asphalt paver submitted and accepted by Client Rep and Contractor to demonstrate the desired slope of the surface is within plus or minus 0.1%
Record documents - Communications with Contractor and Client Rep on Paver Equipment and Levels controls used
Comments - See Cl2 determine what current method used on Paver to control smoothness and transverse slope and add in acceptance criteria

Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Once per project
Inspection / Test method - Certificate of Calibration of full length weigh bridge
Acceptance Criteria - Accurate and passes certification for weighbridge by independent weighbridge certifier

Inspection / Test method - Approved JMF and NZTA M10
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 per day and the 1 per 200 t at asphalt plant
Inspection / Test method - Approved JMF and NZTA M10
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity - Max. Specific Gravity
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 per day and the 1 per 600 t at asphalt plant
Inspection / Test method - Approved JMF and NZTA M10
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity - Lab Air Voids Gyro
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 per project or 1 per 600 tonnes
Inspection / Test method - Approved JMF and NZTA M10
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Detail of Activity - Mix discharge temperature
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - 1 per day and the 1 per 200 t at asphalt plant
Inspection / Test method - Approved JMF and NZTA M10
Acceptance Criteria - >158 degrees as per M10 Notes for S grade binder PG64S
Record documents - Diary Records at Plant
9.3.1 - Planning location of paving runs and joints
Detail of Activity - Determine joint locations and paving runs as acceptable by Client Rep, also agree areas that need to be hand layed
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each paver run
Inspection / Test method - Best Practice/ Drawings/ Visual
Acceptance Criteria - As agreed by Client Rep
Detail of Activity - Locate cold joints and cut back prior to adjacent paving
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each paver run
Inspection / Test method - Best Practice/ Visual
Acceptance Criteria - Visually accepted finished joints (almost invisible joints)
9.3.3 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Detail of Activity - Record temperature of mix in paver, on mat start of rolling and on mat end of rolling
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each paver run
Inspection / Test method - NZTA M10/ Best Practice
Acceptance Criteria - Temperatures >90 degrees (minimum compaction); First delivered in paver mix temp >130 deg - note departure from NZTA M10 Notes that require 146 deg compaction temperature
Comments - Experience found for thin asphalt mix cools very quickly but can still be succesfully compacted on site
9.3.4 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Detail of Activity - Record rolling methodology, types of rollers, order, vibe and static and number of passes
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each paver run
Acceptance Criteria - No Nuke Plateau and/or NDM Density and approved by Area Manager as confirm best practice has be used to achieve compaction on site
9.3.5 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Detail of Activity - NDM or No Nuke Density Measurements on site for Air Voids
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each paver run
Acceptance Criteria - At 10m increments using NDM if required as per NZTA M10 for asphalt mixes >35mm thick
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Comments - If NDM or No Nuke used then evidence of apropriate offset is needed found from correlations between air voids from NDM or No Nuke and extracted core air voids
9.3.6 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Detail of Activity - Extracted Core Air Voids if required
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Each days production 8 on mat and 3 on joints
Acceptance Criteria - Air voids requirements as per NZTA M10. Cores not required as per NZTA M10 for asphalt thickness < 35mm
Record documents - IANZ accredited test cert
Comments - Often for surfacing mixes cores are not allowed due to visually being unacceptable and thus use NDM and NoNule methods above
9.3.7 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Dipstick and field report each truck load
Acceptance Criteria - As per design requirements
9.3.8 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Detail of Activity - Layer Width/ Length and Area per truck
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - Field report each truck load
Acceptance Criteria - As per design requirements
9.3.9 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - every 20m
Acceptance Criteria - < 6mm using 3m straight edge and no areas that can pond water
Comments - Or as agreed prior to sealing in terms of what practically can be achieved based on smoothness of granular base and kerb alignment
9.3.10 - Paving and compacting mix on site
Minimum Test Frequency (Lot = 1 day’s production or 1,500m2) - every 20m
